articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: He is on course for a domestic treble and the kind of individual honours that write players into Scottish football folklore but, like so many of his Celtic colleagues, Kyogo Furuhashi believes he can do even better.
articles.title: The reason Celtic's Kyogo is still not satisfied, as he joins team-mates on PFA Scotland Player of the Year shortlist

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Reo Hatate has responded with bemusement after rumours about his long-term commitment to Celtic began to swirl online in the wake of the club’s title win.
articles.title: PFA Scotland Play of the Year nominee Reo Hatate on missing Celtic's title celebrations: 'It’s not a big deal. People are reading too much into it'

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: “We won the treble that year. In fact, the only thing we didn’t win was the Boat Race. And they still gave it to Ginola! Can you believe that?!” Sir Alex Ferguson at his finest. Eight years had passed but there was still incredulity around David Ginola winning the Football Writers’ Association’s Player of the Year award, plus the PFA accolade, in 1999 rather than one of his treble-winning Manchester United stars.
articles.title: Kevin van Veen: Why Motherwell's 'King' would deserve Player of the Year despite incredible Celtic competition

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic provide two players for PFA Scotland’s four-man shortlist for the Young Player of the Year award, with stars from Rangers and Albion Rovers making up the nominees.
articles.title: The 4 Young Player of the Year nominees from Celtic, Rangers and Albion Rovers

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic dominate the PFA Scotland Premiership Player of the Year nominations with three out of four coming from the Scottish champions.
articles.title: Celtic trio in Player of the Year nomination, Motherwell ace earns spot but no Rangers, Aberdeen, Hearts stars

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: Joe Hart says that even although Celtic fans will be locked out of Ibrox this weekend, the players will still feel their backing.
articles.title: Joe Hart cites Celtic's Australian experience as why they will cope just fine at Rangers

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Queen’s Park were involved in another televised thriller – and it was again heartache for the Spiders as they went down 4-3 to Partick Thistle in the first leg of their Premiership play-off quarter-final tie at Firhill.
articles.title: Play-off drama: Partick edge seven-goal thriller, Falkirk trounced by Airdrie, Adam King incident at Alloa

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: The fair-minded – an admittedly far-from-populous cohort in Scottish football – would recognise that definitive pronouncements on Michael Beale as Rangers manager must be reserved until next season.
articles.title: The 'no-stakes' Rangers-Celtic derby? Unenviable reality facing Michael Beale if Ange Postecoglou gets way

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic defender Carl Starfelt is wanted by a number of clubs across Europe after another successful season with the Scottish champions.
articles.title: The Celtic star attracting interest from the Premier League and Europe, unfinished business at champions?

articles.author: Gavin McCafferty
articles.description: Former Old Firm rivals Martin O’Neill and Alex McLeish are united in their disappointment over the lack of away supporters at games between Celtic and Rangers.
articles.title: 'I never thought I’d see that happening': Call for change on Celtic v Rangers stance

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Billy Gilmour has been advised to sign for Celtic rather than Rangers if the opportunity presents because their style of play will suit him more.
articles.title: Billy Gilmour tipped for Celtic move as ex-England international makes surprise Rangers 'doesn't suit' claim

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic have dominated the PFA Scotland's Premiership team of the year with seven players, with stars from Rangers, Aberdeen and Motherwell making up the rest of the team.
articles.title: Celtic dominate PFA Scotland team of the year with 7, 2 Rangers players plus Aberdeen and Motherwell stars

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic will take on Yokohama F. Marinos during their pre-season tour of Japan and South Korea in what will be a special occasion for Ange Postecoglou, forward Daizen Maeda and midfielder Tomoki Iwata.
articles.title: Celtic Japan tour: First opposition confirmed, ex-Rangers presence, fixture date, tickets details

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Two referees who were at the centre of controversies in Premiership matches involving Hearts and Celtic and Rangers and Aberdeen have been awarded high profile top-flight matches this weekend.
articles.title: Referees at centre of Hearts and Aberdeen controversies given high-profile games, Old Firm ref revealed

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic's 2-0 success at Hearts on Sunday confirmed their status as Scottish Premiership champions as they wrapped up a second title in a row under Ange Postecoglou.
articles.title: Celtic 1 of 8 confirmed for Champions League group stages, £25m windfall, when is the draw, fixture dates

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic manager Ange Postecolgou maintains there will be no easing up in the club’s final four league fixtures despite the title having been sewn up at the weekend.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou is firm on Celtic's next four matches and fires warning to rest of league

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: With an 11th title from the past 12 league seasons now confirmed, the latest success has done little to sate Celtic’s hunger for glory.
articles.title: The 'real' reason for Celtic's success as hunger grows for more silverware

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: It is tempting to see Ange Postecoglou as a cross between a drill sergeant and a life coach to his Celtic players.
articles.title: A glimpse into the 'Celtic family': stern look, different life stages, total alignment

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Former referees Stuart Dougal and Dermot Gallagher have backed the decision to send of Alex Cochrane during Hearts’ 2-0 home defeat to Celtic on Sunday.
articles.title: 'Obvious it is going to be a red' - Hearts v Celtic decision backed by referee duo who claim VAR was correct

articles.author: Mark Atkinson
articles.description: Ange Postecoglou is best suited to Tottenham Hotspur out of all the teams in England looking for a permanent manager but would be best served staying at Celtic, according to former Australia internationalist Mark Bosnich.
articles.title: Ange Postecoglou 'best suited for Tottenham' but Celtic boss advised to remain where he is

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic have seemed on mission as they have thundered towards the title defence which they sealed with their slender 2-0 success against Hearts at Tynecastle. It prompted a few thoughts as they surely close in on a treble.
articles.title: Celtic-Hearts reaction: Postecoglou future; one ginormous gulf; Naismith v Jota

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic have seemed on mission as they have thundered towards the title defence which they sealed with their slender 2-0 success against Hearts at Tynecastle. It prompted a few thoughts as they surely close in on a treble.
articles.title: Celtic-Hearts reaction: Postecoglou may have only just begun; one ginormous gulf; Naismith’s other VAR moment

articles.author: Moira Gordon
articles.description: With his eighth Premiership title now secured, Celtic captain Callum McGregor can focus on another piece of history as he attempts to become the first player in world football to win five trebles.

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Even the footballing aesthetes must sometimes require to become artisans when the occasion demands.
articles.title: Celtic's coronation: Graft not craft at Tynecastle as King Kyogo strikes again - but so does VAR

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Celtic’s Ange Postecoglou remained entirely true to himself and did not indulge in faux modesty as he reflected on leading his club to a second consecutive title, a success that places his team within a Scottish Cup final win of a treble and a haul of five honours across his two-season tenure.
articles.title: 'Not me being arrogant, just the truth': Ange Postecoglou says he always believed he would turn Celtic around as Tynecastle experience comes full circle

articles.description: Celtic wrapped up their 11th Premiership title in 12 years as they defeated Hearts 2-0 to chalk up their 31st league win of a dominant season in front of a packed Tynecastle.
articles.title: Celtic crowned champions while Rangers in action as win over Hearts settles title

articles.description: Celtic can clinch the Scottish Premiership title with a victory at Hearts on Sunday.

articles.description: Celtic’s crowning as champions this season has been their destiny for so long it has almost felt like a birthright. The natural order.
